intro: Dasyglossum callacallaense, commonly known as the Callacalla lily, is a striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink, with a distinctive spurred shape. The plant belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is known for its robust, erect stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists alike.
